content.description: Starts with a thin, small flake. Then a move to a really good ledge. The difficulty comes in when trying to move form the ledge to the next few holds. There are very few holds and the holds are slopey. I found that high stepping and doing a mantel was the best way. This allowed me to reach the next ledge and to the top.
content.protection: Trees to set up top rope

content.description: Start in the obvious, big pocket with both hands. Move your hands up and get your feet on the big sloper ledge. Work your feet across the ledge and top out left. There is still lichen and moss on the boulder, but the key holds are clean enough.
content.location: 3rd area off of the main wall.

content.description: Sit start with your feet towad the right side of the Boulder with your hand on a real nice side pull make your next to the ledge work left on it then work your up to the point

This rock can have multiple paths from the right or left; however, this route goes directly up the center. Start with both hands on a small ledge in the bottom crack. It helps to hold onto the crack if you do a bicycle with your feet. Powerful move to a right hand crimp. Move left hand to a small under cling, then bump up to a small crimp. Move right hand to a small ledge and move left hand to a really bad side pull. From here you have to dyno to the top because there are no holds in between.

This route is named after the pond that forms beneath it in the winter and spring. Sit start with left hand in pocket right hand on the arete. Continue up till you get to a round two handed crimp, cross over the face to a large pocket and little pinches and crimps up to the top.

This climb is in area 3 on the wall start left on corner move up and right you will find a sloppy hold big enough for two hands from there you will keep moving upward and right to a more crimp hold work your feet up as you look for the next crimp which is a bit farther of a reach then the last few holds where it closer to the top and a little right from the last hold then final and slap over the top as u climb up for top out
content.location: The route is in the 3rd area and it is easy to get back to the bottom after topping out u walk down around the wall or there is spot just right of the climb if your on top looking down that you can easily climb down from

content.description: Start on crack follow towards the the top to few nice hand holds then a step over the top
Start below the the small boulder at the bottom making this problem a little longer, continue along the arete through pretty awesome divot features in the rock.
Climb up the crack couple crimps to the right to help stabalize top out.
Beginner's crack is a fairly straight forward climb. Just follow the crack with both hands and walk your feet up the sides.

For this climb it is easiest to start with your hands on the flake. Work your feet and hands up until you can reach the hole with some good jugs inside. The crux is the next move, the ledge is very slopey. To find a good hold, you want to reach high and right with your right hand. Once you get this, you can pull yourself up to the crack. There are many holds and ways to go once you pass this.
content.protection: Two trees at the top to rope off.

content.description: Area 3 is close to Route 56 and can be accessed through an access road. This area is full of small boulders that are scattered all around. There is a high wall about 35 foot that can be used for top roping.
